meanings.definition: The center of interest or activity.
meanings.sent1: In the painting, the artist made the flower the focus of the artwork.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's focus during the lesson was on multiplication.
meanings.sent3: The focus of the party was the delicious cake that everyone enjoyed.
meanings.sent4: Her bright smile was the focus of the room, lighting up the whole space.
meanings.sent5: The bright red balloon was the focus of the children's attention at the party.

meanings.sent1: During the test, I need to focus on answering each question carefully.
meanings.sent2: She needed to focus on finishing her homework before going out to play.
meanings.sent3: I tried to focus on studying, but my cat kept distracting me by playing with my pencil.
meanings.sent4: As the deadline approached, she had to focus all her energy on completing the project.
meanings.sent5: The athlete needed to focus on his breathing to maintain his stamina during the race.

meanings.definition: To adjust the focus of a lens or optical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The photographer needed to focus the camera lens to capture a clear image.
meanings.sent2: He carefully focused the binoculars to get a better view of the distant mountains.
meanings.sent3: She tried to focus the microscope, but it took a few tries to get the image sharp.
meanings.sent4: The astronomer adjusted the telescope to focus on a specific star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: To take a clear picture, make sure to focus the camera lens on the subject before clicking.
